p: In 13 unadjusted studies and two adjusted studies, 34, 37, 38, 39, 47, 49, 51, 54, 58, 60, 61, 65, 75 eye protection was associated with lower risk of infection (unadjusted n=3713, RR 0·34, 95% CI 0·22 to 0·52; AR 5·5% with eye protection vs 16·0% with no eye protection, RD −10·6%, 95% CI −12·5 to −7·7; adjusted n=701, aOR 0·22, 95% CI 0·12 to 0·39; low certainty; figure 6; table 2; appendix pp 16–17).
